Operations Performed

  • Arthroscopically aided anterior cruciate ligament repair/augmentation or reconstruction (29888)
  • Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscectomy (medial OR lateral, including any meniscal shaving) including debridement/shaving of articular cartilage (chondroplasty), same or separate compartment(s), when performed (29881)

Surgeon

  • Orthopedic Surgery, MD

Date of surgery

  • Friday, June 21, 2013

Preoperative Diagnosis

  • Sprain and strain of cruciate ligament of knee (844.2)
  • Derangement of posterior horn of medial meniscus (717.2)

Postoperative Diagnosis

  • Derangement of posterior horn of medial meniscus (717.2)
  • Sprain and strain of cruciate ligament of knee (844.2)

Indications for Surgery

Indications

  • Acute Knee Injury
  • Knee Pain, Acute
  • Swelling
  • Stiffness
  • Instability

Risk and Consent

Risk Factors

  • None

ASA Physical Status

  • Class I. Normal healthy patient

Informed Consent

  • Yes: Indications for surgical procedure, risks, benefits, possible complications explained to patient including alternatives in treatment. Patient had the chance to ask questions and all were answered to their satisfaction. Patient understood and gave consent.

Operative Findings

Operative Findings

  • Suprapatellar pouch revealed hemosiderin staining
  • Posterior surface of patella normal
  • Femoral trochlea normal
  • Complete tear of ACL
  • Tibial end remaining
  • Posterior horn of medial meniscus tear noted

Preparation

Anesthesia

  • General
  • Regional, Peripheral Nerve Blocks

Position

  • Supine

Surgical Field

  • Clipped
  • 1% tincture of Iodine

Draping

  • Draped in a Sterile Fashion

Pre-medication

  • Femoral nerve block
  • 1 Gm Ancef
  • Prophylactic antibiotic

Operative Description

Arthroscopically aided anterior cruciate ligament repair/augmentation or reconstruction (29888)

Laterality

  • Right

Operation Description

  • Tourniquet Used
  • Tourniquet inflated to 250mm Hg
  • Portal incision performed on either side of the patellar tendon
  • Arthrex Video and Crossfire Systems Used
  • Arthroscope with video camera inserted through lateral portal
  • Digital Images recorded for documentation purposes
  • Debridement of ACL Remnant
  • Limited lateral notchplasty performed
  • Small transverse incision of proximal tibia performed
  • Tibial alignment guide used
  • Drill hole made over guidewire
  • 10mm Drill Hole made
  • Knee shaved to remove debris from around drill site and soft tissue
  • Edges smoothed with rasp
  • Knee placed in hyperflexion position
  • Femoral alignment guide used
  • Guidewire placed through tibial drill hole, through isometric point of femur
  • 10mm drill hole made to a depth of 35 mm
  • Notch made at 12 o'clock position
  • Grafton injected into femoral drill hole
  • 10mm Tibialis Allograft Used
  • Tibialis Allograft pulled into knee joint
  • Arthex Femoral Screw Inserted 9x23mm
  • Knee extended to 30 degrees
  • Notch made at 12 o'clock position in tibial drill hole
  • Nitinol wire inserted
  • Bioabsorbable screw inserted over a nitinol wire
  • Arthrex Bioabsorbable Screw 11x28mm Used
  • Purchase of tibia secured
  • Full range of motion with complete extension present
  • Complete Correction of Lachman sign noted
  • Hemostasis assured
  • Knee irrigated
  • Wounds closed with 3-0 Prolene
  • Sterile compressive dressing applied

Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscectomy (medial OR lateral, including any meniscal shaving) including debridement/shaving of articular cartilage (chondroplasty), same or separate compartment(s), when performed (29881)

Laterality

  • Right

Operation Description

  • Partial meniscectomy, Medial
  • Posterior horn tear resected
  • Stable Rim Present

Discharge and Condition

Estimated blood loss

  • 10 mL or less

Sponge/needle/instrument count

  • Correct x 2

Discharge

  • Surgical day care recovery

Condition

  • Stable

DVT Prophylaxis

  • Not applicable

Specimen

  • Sent to pathology
  • Bone
  • Synovium
  • Cartilage

Complications

  • No complications

Signature

  • Signed by Orthopedic Surgery, MD at 2:29 PM Wednesday, July 17, 2013
